what's your problem?: the apache2 server is trying to find libphp4.so in /etc/apache2/modules/, but
copying shouldn't be necessary
ok what do I do to solve this problem?
the server can find php4 files.
how did you install apache and php?
I used synaptic on a hoary system.
then php should just work.
you can try 'sudo apt-get install --reinstall libapache2-mod-php4' in the console.
well, when I enter apache2 -t I get a failure tell met that libphp4.so can not be found.
oh. ok. that's telling you that you've changed sometihng in the config.
that is why I move libphp4.so to where apchae2 was looking for it.
yes I did. I add a LoadModule directive for php4 as per instructions.
remove it.
remove the bit you added.
and try apache2 -t again.
One second, I'll give it a shot.
Ok that worked. Can you explain why I didn't need it?
because it's added automatically by the php4 installation. the reason you don't see it is that it's loaded from /etc/apache2/mods-enabled/php4.load
